etymologies: Old English hǣring, hēring, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch haring and German Hering

definitions: a silvery fish that is most abundant in coastal waters and is of great commercial importance as a food fish in many parts of the world.

notes.text: Clupea and other genera, family Clupeidae (the herring family): several species, in particular (C. harengus), of the North Atlantic. The herring family also includes the sprats, shads, and pilchards

shortDefinitions: fairly small silvery fish which is most abundant in coastal waters
